storyTitle: As User, I want to customize my notification preferences to achieve better control over alerts

testCases.title: Validate saving of notification preferences
preconditions: User is logged into the system with valid credentials
User has an active account with notification settings enabled
User has permission to modify notification preferences

steps.action: Navigate to notification settings page from user profile or settings menu
steps.expectedResult: Notification settings page is displayed with all available options visible including notification channels (email, SMS, in-app), frequency settings, and conflict type options

steps.action: Select preferred notification channels by checking email, SMS, and/or in-app notification options
steps.expectedResult: Selected channels are highlighted/checked without any errors, UI responds immediately to selections, and no error messages are displayed

steps.action: Select notification frequency from available options (immediate, daily digest, weekly summary)
steps.expectedResult: Frequency option is selected and visually indicated as active

steps.action: Choose conflict types to be notified about (scheduling conflicts, resource conflicts, priority conflicts)
steps.expectedResult: Conflict types are selected and marked appropriately in the UI
System processes the request within 2 seconds, displays a success confirmation message (e.g., 'Preferences saved successfully'), and the save button may briefly show a loading state

steps.action: Verify that the saved preferences are retained by refreshing the page or navigating away and returning to notification settings
steps.expectedResult: All previously selected preferences are displayed correctly and remain saved

postconditions: User notification preferences are saved in the database
User preferences are associated with the user profile
System is ready to send notifications based on new preferences
Confirmation message is displayed to the user

testCases.title: Ensure preferences are applied consistently
preconditions: User is logged into the system with valid credentials
User has previously saved notification preferences
User has selected specific notification channels (e.g., email and in-app)
System has the ability to generate scheduling conflicts for testing
User has access to the selected notification channels

steps.expectedResult: Notification settings page is displayed with current preferences shown

steps.action: Change notification preferences by selecting different channels (e.g., change from email only to email + SMS) and/or modify frequency settings
steps.expectedResult: New preferences are selected and visually indicated in the UI
System confirms preferences are updated successfully with a confirmation message, update is processed within 2 seconds

steps.action: Trigger a scheduling conflict by creating or simulating a double-booking scenario or resource conflict
steps.expectedResult: Scheduling conflict is created successfully in the system and conflict detection mechanism identifies it

steps.action: Wait for notification to be sent and check the selected notification channel(s) for incoming notification
steps.expectedResult: Notification is sent via the newly selected channel(s) only (e.g., email and SMS if both were selected), notification arrives within expected timeframe

steps.action: Verify notification content includes conflict details such as conflict type, affected resources, time/date, and recommended actions
steps.expectedResult: Notification content accurately matches user preferences, includes all relevant conflict information, is formatted correctly, and matches the selected conflict types from preferences

steps.action: Verify that notifications are NOT sent through channels that were deselected
steps.expectedResult: No notifications appear in deselected channels, confirming preferences are applied consistently

steps.action: Trigger another scheduling conflict of a different type to verify consistency
steps.expectedResult: Notification is sent again via the same selected channels with appropriate content based on conflict type preferences

postconditions: Updated notification preferences are active and applied system-wide
Notifications are sent only through selected channels
System maintains consistency across multiple notification events
Test conflicts can be cleaned up or marked as resolved
